committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Administration of Justice

official_title: To amend title 28, United States Code, with respect to the term of office of the Director of the Federal Judicial Center, and with respect to creditable service of certain officials of the judicial branch for purposes of retirement.

summary.text: Amends the Federal judicial code to require a Director of the Federal Judicial Center to be retired at age 70 (as under current law) or after completing five years of service as Director, whichever occurs later. Includes as creditable service for purposes of Federal retirement provisions applicable to the Director, the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts, and the Administrative Assistant to the Chief Justice any service as the principal administrative assistant to a Senator or Representative in the Congress or as the staff director or chief counsel of a Senate or House committee or subcommittee.

titles.title: To amend title 28, United States Code, with respect to the term of office of the Director of the Federal Judicial Center, and with respect to creditable service of certain officials of the judicial branch for purposes of retirement.
